headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body:
@ihower You're right. The issue was specific to using a non-OpenAI model.

I confirmed that switching to an OpenAI model (gpt-5.2) works as expected.
After that, I updated to openai-agents[litellm]==0.6.5 (I was previously on 0.6.4) per your guidance.

After the update, I re-tested with a non-OpenAI model and the issue no longer occurs. I no longer need the temporary workaround I mentioned earlier.

Thanks for the help. This resolves the issue on my end.
